docs.lead_paragraph: Senate Republicans on Saturday sought to increase the pressure on Democrats over a new actuarial report suggesting that major health care legislation would increase national spending on medical care rather than lower costs.

headline.main: Republicans Keep Up Pressure on Cost of Health Plan

docs.lead_paragraph: Two new studies suggest that bisphosphonate drugs taken to prevent bone loss may help fight breast cancer.

headline.main: Bone Drugs Taken by Some Women May Lower Breast Cancer Risk, Studies Say
headline.print_headline: Bone Drugs Taken by Some Women May Lower Breast Cancer Risk, Studies Say

docs.snippet: Two new studies suggest that bisphosphonate drugs taken to prevent bone loss may help fight breast cancer.

docs.lead_paragraph: Editor's Note: Among the many uncertainties as Congress re-examines every aspect of health care is this: how will the legislation affect Medicare? In fact, for the last few years, doctor's fees have been slated for huge cuts, but Congress has always rolled them back in a process that has come to be known as the "doc fix." Will that happen this year? Not clear. But while Congress continues to negotiate the shape of the nation's health care system -- and ponders how to pay for it -- our local Old Man worries aloud about what life would look like if services near to his heart fall on the chopping block.
docs.abstract: I know my doctors aren't getting rich off me as a Medicare patient now. Take away at least one-fifth of their income, and I might have to look elsewhere. And that prospect was not encouraging.
docs.snippet: I know my doctors aren't getting rich off me as a Medicare patient now. Take away at least one-fifth of their income, and I might have to look elsewhere. And that prospect was not encouraging.
